occurrences.text: He has a purpose, and even in that time of affliction, God can use you and can cause you to be fruitful. He says, knowing for yourselves know that we are appointed thereunto. Notice in 2 Thessalonians chapter number 1, and then we're going to come back to 1 Thessalonians because I want you to see the perspective and the opportunity that we can be fruitful even in the midst of affliction. In 2 Thessalonians 1 and verse number 4, the Bible says so that we ourselves glory in you in the churches of God for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and tribulations that ye endure. They were suffering. The church in Thessalonica, the believers, they were dealing with persecution and all these hardships and things that were taking place, and Paul says that you have patience and faith in all your persecutions and tribulations that ye endure. He said in chapter 3 of the first book, he says that no man should be moved by these afflictions, but I want you to go all the way back to the first chapter of 1 Thessalonians. First Thessalonians. And I want you to see that a people, a church that was facing persecution, affliction, and difficulty, that God had allowed them to be fruitful even in a season of difficulty and affliction. The Bible says in verse number seven of First Thessalonians one, actually back up to verse number four, if you will,
